client_profile: Couple looking to buy an apartment in Brussels. Budget is 490,000–895,000 EUR. Priorities include cafes & brunch, expats & international, and value for money.
red_flags: Short lease terms in certain buildings

top_districts.name: Ixelles
why: Vibrant expat community anchored by Flagey square and countless brunch cafes.
Easy transit connections via the multiple tram lines serving the area.
watch_out: Property prices may stretch the budget due to high demand.

top_districts.name: Saint-Gilles
why: Known for its cultural diversity, with weekly markets and various brunch spots.
Metro station offers quick access to the city center and beyond.
watch_out: Some noisy areas may affect living quality, especially at night.

top_districts.name: Woluwe-Saint-Lambert
why: Family-friendly district featuring parks and affordable cafes for brunch outings.
Major bus and tram lines provide direct links to central Brussels.
watch_out: Potential for budget stretch due to family-oriented amenities.

agencies.name: L&P Real Estate
agencies.note: Experts in Brussels real estate market.

next_steps: Schedule property viewings in top districts.
